snippet: The bill would create a state monitor for the East Ramapo School District, where a school board run by Orthodox Jews has been criticized for shifting money from public schools to local yeshivas.
abstract: Bid to impose monitor on East Ramapo School District in Rockland County meets resistance in New York Legislature; New York State Education Dept had concluded that East Ramapo school board show favoritism to Orthodox Jewish students, drawing money from public schools to students in local yeshivas.
lead_paragraph: The bill would create a state monitor for the East Ramapo School District, where a school board run by Orthodox Jews has been criticized for shifting money from public schools to local yeshivas.

headline.main: Bid to Impose Monitor on East Ramapo School Board Meets Resistance
headline.print_headline: Push for a Schools Monitor in Rockland County Falters
